discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
ans is C. city is 2 times

Why not C? Duplicate data.
Because City is 2 times..
A. There is City and City, State, which makes it redundant.

A. Data completeness

The greatest issue presented by the missing rows of data is related to data completeness. Data completeness refers to the extent to which all required data is present in the dataset. In this scenario, the missing rows indicate that the dataset is not complete, which can lead to biased analyses and inaccurate conclusions if not addressed.

While data integrity, consistency, and accuracy are also important data qualities, the missing rows directly impact data completeness by reducing the overall amount of data available for analysis. Ensuring data completeness is essential for reliable and meaningful analysis and decision-making.

questions.question_text: An analyst is summarizing the results from a recently completed survey. The results have been validated, but the analyst notices a few rows of data are missing at the bottom. For which of the following data qualities does this present the GREATEST issue?

discussion.content:
C. SQL

SQL (Structured Query Language) is specifically designed for retrieving, manipulating, and managing data in relational database management systems (RDBMS). It is the standard language for accessing and querying data stored in databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, and others. SQL provides powerful capabilities for selecting specific data, filtering results, joining tables, aggregating data, and performing various other operations necessary for data analysis. While R and Python can also be used for data analysis and manipulation, SQL is the most appropriate tool for retrieving data from a relational database management system.

questions.question_text: Which of the following data analytics tools would be BEST to retrieve data from a relational database management system?

discussion.content:
B. Data accuracy
F. Data consistency

By standardizing the term used for "average" responses to just "average," the analyst is likely aiming to improve both data accuracy and data consistency.

Data accuracy is crucial in ensuring that the information collected reflects the true values or opinions of the respondents. By consolidating variations of the term "average" into a single standard term, the analyst reduces potential confusion or misinterpretation of the data.

Additionally, maintaining data consistency enhances the overall quality and usability of the dataset. Consistent formatting and terminology make it easier to analyze and compare data across different responses and sections of the survey.

questions.question_text: A data analyst is reviewing the results of a survey. Respondents used the terms “avg,” “average,” and “avg.” throughout the survey in a response for the word “average.” Because of this, the analyst changed all related answers to say “average.” Which of the following are reasons why the analyst MOST likely made these changes? (Choose two.)

A business analyst reviews the following text:

txt = “I have registered for a certification exam and will take it within a couple of months. I need to work hard to pass the exam with flying colors.”

The analyst then splits the string into two parts:

txt1 = “I have registered for a certification exam and will take it within a couple of months.”

txt2 = “I need to work hard to pass the exam with flying colors.”

Which of the following BEST describes the process the business analyst is following?

discussion.content:
D. String manipulation

The business analyst is manipulating the original string (txt) by splitting it into two separate strings (txt1 and txt2). This process involves modifying the structure or content of the text data, which falls under the category of string manipulation.
